member.name: T:Microsoft.Maps.Core.GetNearestStreetsideLocationCompleted
member.summary: Contains the result returned when a call to the method completes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.GetNearestStreetsideLocationCompleted.Result
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the nearest location to the requested location that has available StreetsideTM imagery. If no nearby location is found, this value is null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D
member.summary: Represents a three dimensional vector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The value of the Z vector.
The value of the X vector.
The value of the Y vector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D.X
member.summary: Gets the value of the X vector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D.Y
member.summary: Gets the value of the Y vector.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D.Z
member.summary: Gets the value of the Z vector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera
member.summary: Represents the view orientation in a StreetsideTM map. The camera is positioned in WGS84 space.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.Changed
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, occurs when any parameter of the camera is changed including field of view (zoom), look at, look up, or position. Note that this event is fired every frame during transitions.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.Stopped
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, occurs when the camera stops moving after a transition or after a jump to a new location.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.SetLookAt(Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D,Microsoft.Maps.Core.MapVector3D)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the “look at” and “look up” parameters for the camera in WGS84 space, which makes easier to use.
member.param: The “look up” unit vector of the camera.
The “look at” unit vector of the camera.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.FarPlaneDistance
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the far plane distance of the camera in meters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.HorizontalFieldOfView
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the horizontal field of view of the camera in radians.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.LookAt
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the “look at” unit vector of the camera.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.LookUp
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the “look up” unit vector of the camera.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.NearPlaneDistance
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the near plane distance of the camera in meters.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.Position
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the position of the camera.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.VerticalFieldOfView
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the vertical field of view of the camera in radians.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideCamera.Zoom
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the camera zoom, where 0 is zoomed out all the way and 1 is zoomed in all the way.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract
member.summary: Provides the ability to interact with a StreetsideTM map.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.ActivateStreetside(Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideLocation,System.Boolean,System.Action)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, activates the StreetsideTM map mode if it is not already the active map mode and optionally performs an animated transition from the current map mode.
member.param: The action to take when the Streetside map is active and ready to use.
A bool indicating whether to animate the transition to the Streetside map. If this value is false, the map snaps to a Streetside map.
The location to transition to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.ActivateStreetside(Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideLocation,System.Boolean,System.Double,System.Action)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, activates the StreetsideTM map mode if it is not already the active map mode and optionally performs an animated transition from the current map mode.
member.param: The action to take when the Streetside map is active and ready to use.
A bool indicating whether to animate the transition to the Streetside map. If this value is false, the map snaps to a Streetside map.
The location to transition to.
The heading in degrees to animate to, where 0 is north, 90 is east, 180 is south, and 270 is west.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.GetNearestStreetsideLocation(Microsoft.Maps.MapControl.Location,System.Action{Microsoft.Maps.Core.GetNearestStreetsideLocationCompleted})
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, retrieves the closest location with available StreetsideTM imagery.
member.param: The action to take if Streetside imagery is found at the specified location.
The location to check for Streetside imagery.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.MoveToLocation(Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideLocation,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Action)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves the StreetsideTM camera to the given location and optionally animates the move. This method throws an exception if Streetside is not the active map mode.
member.param: The camera zoom level, where 0 is zoomed out all the way and 1 is zoomed in all the way.
The pitch in degrees. Positive values look upwards and negative values look down.
The heading in degrees, where 0 is north, 90 is east, 180 is south, and 270 is west.
The action to take when the location move is completed or interrupted.
A bool indicating whether to animate the transition to the Streetside map. If this value is false, the map snaps to a Streetside map.
The location to move the camera to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.MoveToLocationWithViewpoint(Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideLocation,Microsoft.Maps.MapControl.Location,System.Boolean,System.Action)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, moves the StreetsideTM camera to the given location while keeping the location in view. This method throws an exception if Streetside is not the active map mode.
member.param: A bool indicating whether to zoom the camera out during the move.
The action to take when the move is completed or interrupted.

The location to keep in view while moving. Locations with of Ellipsoid in WGS84 space will be most accurate. Ground and Surface will both use an altitude relative to the new camera center and using SeaLevel will throw an exception.
The location to move the camera to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.SetCameraOrientation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the camera orientation either by animating to the new orientation or by snapping to the new orientation. This method throws and exception if StreetsideTM is not the active map mode.
member.param: The camera zoom level, where 0 is zoomed out all the way and 1 is zoomed in all the way.
The pitch in degrees. Positive values look upwards and negative values look down.
A bool indicating whether to animate the camera move. If this value is false, the camera snaps to the new orientation.
The heading in degrees, where 0 is north, 90 is east, 180 is south, and 270 is west.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.Camera
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the camera object for StreetsideTM. An exception is thrown if a get is attempted when Streetside is not the active map mode, but the event handlers may still be used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideContract.CursorVisible
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the visibility of the cursor. Mouse events must be handled separately to disable clicking and dragging.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Maps.Core.StreetsideLocation
member.summary: Represents a location in a StreetsideTM map that a camera can be moved to. This class should not be directly instantiated but should be created using the method.
